channel.title: Outgoing mail mercury
channel.description:
I am trying to set up a mail server on my computer, local mail works and incoming mail works but I cannot sent mail with it. ive been trying for so long and i have no progress at all. here is what i get when i send a message. [code] 21:02:41: processing job MO00000D Resolved MX for 'yahoo.com' to 66.196.97.250 Connecting to 66.196.97.250 Connection error. Attempting connection to alternate, 66.196.82.7 Connection error on alternate. Attempting connection to alternate, 216.39.53.3 Connection error on alternate. Attempting connection to alternate, 68.142.202.247 Connection error on alternate.
[/code]

item.title: Outgoing mail mercury
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

hmm well i was randomly able to email gmail and hotmail, i still cant email aim or yahoo or roadrunner but if i try to connect via telnet it returns a web address that mentions the spam thing i tried, I think i just have to wait for them to update their stuff now and il be good.

Read full topic

item.title: Outgoing mail mercury
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Chances are you wont be able to get rdns set up to your home computer. Your ISP has to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Outgoing mail mercury
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

lol, na, that was last week this week im trying to set up a mail server. still no luck, ive tried just about everything i can and still no luck, any ideas?

Read full topic

i thought you were mailing mercury to someone

item.title: Outgoing mail mercury
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

mines good, ip never changes, 1500kbps, and my friends is the same sept like 22000kbps, maybe it has to do with us being on the list, we are gunna try to remove ourselves and see what happens, still not sure if i have a reverse dns or not tho

I had a domain name, and according to my friend thats a reverse lookup dns, so i guess i do, unlised myself from that spam site and still the same errors, i am at a loss now.

Read full topic

item.title: Outgoing mail mercury
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Resolved MX for 'hotmail.com' to 65.54.245.104
Connecting to 65.54.245.104
MAIL FROM:<admin@mixscape.info>
  550 DY-001 Mail rejected by Windows Live Hotmail for policy reasons. We gen
550 DY-001 Mail rejected by Windows Live Hotmail for policy reasons. We gen
12:49:42: 5 seconds elapsed, closing connection.

thats hotmail, and i left it out but we also tried gmail, so far weve got rejected by aim, gmail, RR, yahoo, and hotmail
full error, from google lol, is

50 DY-001 Mail rejected by Windows Live Hotmail for policy reasons. We generally do not accept email from dynamic IP's as they are not typically used to deliver unauthenticated SMTP e-mail to an Internet mail server. http://www.spamhaus.org maintains lists of dynamic and residential IP addresses. If you are not an email/network admin please contact your E-mail/Internet Service Provider for help. Email/network admins, please visit http://postmaster.live.com for email delivery information and support>

Read full topic

item.title: Outgoing mail mercury
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

my dns, i used the ones i saw when i did ipconfig /all, and my ip never changes, i have a domain name, mixscape.info, not sure what a full reverse dns is, that may be my problem. This morning my friend got ingoing working so i set a test to his, and it went through, so i just get errors when i try road runner, yahoo, or aim.

Read full topic

item.title: Outgoing mail mercury
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

What is your DNS setup? Do you have a static IP and full reverse dns set up? If not, you will not be able to send mail to yahoo, aol and most other big providers. You can set up mercury to relay outgoing mail through an SMTP server, thats about the only way around it.

Read full topic
